subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... So are you saying that C++ interpretes at compile time??? Or that in fact interpretation *can* be avoided? BTW, I would say that Java nowadays deals whith
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:
> On Tue, 30 Sep 2003, Ilja Preuss wrote:
>
>>> Interpretation cannot be avoided if you use interfaces, abstraction,
>>> and operations like instanceof.
>>
>> I'd think that C++ does provide the same features, doesn't it? Would
>> you say it's an interpreted language?
>
> Yes, to a degree. However, C++ deals with much of this at
> compile time.

So are you saying that C++ interpretes at compile time??? Or that in
fact interpretation *can* be avoided?

BTW, I would say that Java nowadays deals whith much of this at compile
time, too. It just defers compile time until early runtime... ;)

Take care, Ilja
